title: Unspecified error need to check logs HELP PLOOX
body: Can't get onto league .-. comes up with that error.

replies.body: Is your patch getting stuck at a certain percentage (such as 33%)?

Ok, the two fixes I've known to solve this in the past are the one I've given to DuckyNhoc, above, and the one below. Try the former one first as it requires less download time.

Second fix:

Delete your lol_air_client project folder located at: C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\projects\lol_air_client\ and patch up again.
As a heads up, this will delete your custom item sets if you have any so I would suggest to back them up before deleting the air client folder. Here is how: https://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/21743560-Getting-Started-with-Item-Sets-#backing

>located at: C:\Riot Games\League of...

I use a custom path. It's installed in C:\Everything\Games\Riot Games\League of... Nevertheless, I've tried the method you told DuckyNhoc to no avail. (Seriously, I don't think just 'redownload the patcher' is a feasible solution. Whatever caused it to stop working in the first place will happen again, so it only really solves the problem once, if at all. It would be better to find out *why* it isn't working, and to change that)

I then tried deleting lol_air_client, and that brings me to this frozen state (after hours of waiting), screen attached. Note the 0 KBps. The way I solved this last time was by setting my DNS to port 8.8.8.8, but since the port is already set to that, it's just got me stuffed.

I do hope you see this notification amongst the many I'm sure you have, since you have left by now.
I can't get on to the patcher it just stays at the league of legends logo and then the error occurs

Ok try this:

1) Delete the lol_launcher and lol_patcher folders located in C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\projects.
2) Restart PC and without opening anything else (turn off any background programs as well) run the patcher again, the LoL logo will stay there for a while with a little progress bar underneath it. Do not try to run LoL again or any other program, the launcher should eventually appear.
I have did as you instructed and it still hasn't been opening it's giving me the same error message. Also I do not see a progress bar.
Is it possible for you to reply with a screenshot of the error? Also, please attach your latest patcher logs which can be found here: C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\Logs\Patcher Logs
Also i do not know how to find the log's because i am using mac.

Ok, please try the previous steps again. For Mac:

1) Open a new Finder window, navigate to your Applications folder, and find League of Legends.app
2) Right click, Show Package Contents
3) Open Contents\League of Legends\RADS and delete the 'downloads' & 'solutions' folders.
4) Restart and try patching again.

I won't be able to provide support for the rest of the day, so if your issue is not resolved after this I'd ask that you lodge a [support ticket](https://support.leagueoflegends.com/anonymous_requests/new).

Getting the same error atm.

Just a few things I'd like to know. What OS are you on, who's your ISP and what's your DNS? If you don't know what they mean, just ask.
I don't know what they mean.

OS is operating system, most times it's either Mac or Windows.
ISP is Internet Service Provider. This is the company that is providing you with an internet connection, some common ones are Optus, Telcom and TPG.
DNS is Domain Name Server. If you don't know what that means you don't have to worry about it for now, I just wanted to know if you changed it yourself.

**Riot Gehirn** has made you attempt to redownload the patcher, but that failed to work, hence the problem lies earlier than that. If you go to [this site](https://signup.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/signup/redownload) and attempt to re-download the installer, what happens?

Note: **Do not install anything yet.**
